alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Washington; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 8:04AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Washington, northern Clarke and southwestern Wilcox Counties through 845 AM CDT... At 804 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles east of Coffeeville, or 14 miles west of Grove Hill, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Thomasville, Grove Hill, Pine Hill, Coffeeville, Fulton and Yellow Bluff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama.
